name: uniex

stmt.origin: vtocl(hs0, c0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe), wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe))
stmt.pretty: vtocl(hs0, c0, ⋃ c0 ∈ 𝕌, ⋃ hs0 ∈ 𝕌)

|- wcel(cuni(c0), universe)

-| wcel(cuni(cv(hs0)), universe)
-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe))

body.origin:

-| wex(hs1, wceq(cv(hs1), cuni(cv(hs0))))
-| diffsc(hs1, cuni(cv(hs0)))
body.pretty:
⊢ ⋃ hs0 ∈ 𝕌
⊣ ∃(hs1, hs1 = ⋃ hs0)
⊣ d(hs1, ⋃ hs0)

-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(cuni(c0), universe))
-| diffsc(hs1, cuni(cv(hs0)))
-| diffss(hs1, hs0)

⊣ d(hs0, c0)

⊣ d(hs1, hs0)

comment: The Axiom of Union in class notation. This says that if ` A ` is a set i.e. ` A e. _V ` (see ~ isset ), then the union of ` A ` is also a set. Same as Axiom 3 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 16. (Contributed by NM, 11-Aug-1993.)
